alert.note: Alert for Dona Ana (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 6:47PM MDT until June 16 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central New Mexico and western Texas, including the following counties, in south central New Mexico, Dona Ana. In western Texas, El Paso. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 647 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West El Paso, Chaparral, Anthony, Berino, Canutillo, Anthony Gap, La Union, Chamberino, Vinton, Westway, Union Pacific Intermodal Terminal and Franklin Mountains State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
